Functions#

Solvers#

SolveProblem(self, ProblemType)#

USAGE:

self = SolveProblem(self, ProblemType)

INPUTS:
self

Struct with all the data (initial mixture, conditions, and databases)

ProblemType

String with the name of the problem to solve

OUTPUTS:
self

Struct with all the data (initial mixture, conditions, databases, and results)

Functions#

ComputeProperties(self, SpeciesMatrix, p, T)#

Compute properties from the given SpeciesMatrix at pressure p [bar] and temperature T [K]

Plotting(app, display_species, flag, flag_TP)#

PLOT FIGURES

INPUT:

app = all data

OUTPUT:

Figures

help Plotting

SetSpecies(self, species, N, T)#

function M = SetSpecies(self, species, N, T) DESCRIPTION: Create the stoichiometric matrix INPUT:

self = contains necessary data Species = species contained in the system N = number of moles of each species T = Temperature of the species

OUTPUT:

M = properties matrix

Stoich_Matrix(self)#

Create stoichiometric matrix

cell2vector(varargin)#

Convert values of a individual cell into a vector. If the value correspond with a struct it can return as a vector the values of a given fieldname.

compute_first_derivative(x, y)#

Compute first central derivate with non-uniform grid

compute_temperature_mixture(self, species, moles, temperatures)#

Compute equilibrium temperature [K] of a gaseous mixture compound of n species with species at different temperatures.

Inputs:

  • self: struct variable with all the data of the App (databases)

  • species: cell array with the species of the mixture

  • moles: vector or cell array with the number of moles of each species

  • temperatures: vector or cell array with the temperatures of each species

Output:

  • T: scalar with the temperature of the mixture at equilibrium

find_ind(S, species)#

Find index of the species in the list S

get_order(value)#

Get order of magnitude of a number in base 10

list_phase_species(self, LS)#

Establish cataloged list of species according to the state of the phase (gaseous or condensed). It also obtains the indices of cryogenic liquid species, i.e., liquified gases.

set_prop(varargin)#

Assign property values to the respective variables

vector2cell(value)#

Create cell array from vector

Chemical equilibrium#

complete_combustion(self, mix, phi)#

Solve chemical equilibrium for CHNO mixtures assuming a complete combustion

Extended description of function.

Parameters

  • self (struct) – Data of the mixture, conditions, and databases

  • mix (struct) – Properties of the initial mixture

  • phi (float) – Equivalence ratio [-]

Returns

Equilibrium composition [moles] at defined Temperature species (str): Species considered in the complemte combustion model

Return type

N0 (float)

equilibrate_T(self, strR, pP, TP)#

Set List of Species to List of Products

equilibrium(self, pP, TP, strR)#

Generalized Gibbs minimization method

equilibrium_dT(self, N0, TP, strR)#

Generalized Gibbs minimization method

equilibrium_dp(self, N0, strR)#

Generalized Gibbs minimization method

equilibrium_ions(self, pP, TP, strR)#

Generalized Gibbs minimization method

Shocks and detonations#

cj_detonation(varargin)#

Solve Chapman-Jouguet detonation

compute_guess_det(self, str1, phi, overdriven)#

Paramenters

det_oblique_beta(varargin)#

Solve oblique shock for a given shock wave angle

det_oblique_theta(varargin)#

Solve oblique shock

overdriven_detonation(varargin)#

Solve Overdriven detonation

shock_ideal_gas(gamma, M1)#

Compute jump conditions for a given adiabatic index (gamma) and a array of incident Mach numbers (M1).

shock_incident(varargin)#

Solve planar incident shock wave

shock_oblique_beta(varargin)#

Solve oblique shock for a given shock wave angle

shock_oblique_reflected_theta(varargin)#

Solve oblique shock

shock_oblique_theta(varargin)#

Solve oblique shock

shock_polar(varargin)#

Solve oblique shock

shock_reflected(varargin)#

Solve planar reflected shock wave

therm_effects_air(varargin)#

load test_O2.mat load CombustionToolboxAir.mat R P T M1 M2 Gammas

load thermo_num_air.mat

r.R = R; r.P = P; r.T = T; r.M1 = M1; r.M2 = M2; r.Gammas = Gammas; clearvars R P T M1 M2 Gammas;

therm_effects_diatomic_sym(varargin)#

Get parameters

Rocket propellant performance#

compute_IAC_model(self, mix2, mix3)#

Compute thermochemical composition for Infinite-Area-Chamber (IAC) model

compute_chemical_equilibria(self, mix1, pP, mix2)#

Compute chemical equilibria for the 2 given thermodynamic states, e.g., enthalpy-pressure (HP)

compute_rocket_parameters(mix2, mix3)#

Compute Rocket performance parameters

guess_pressure_IAC_model(mix)#

Compute pressure guess [bar] for Infinite-Area-Chamber (IAC)

rocket_performance(varargin)#

Routine that computes the propellant rocket performance

Settings#

self#

App(varargin)#

Function that create a struct called app with all the data needed

Initialize(self)#

  1. Check that all species are contained in the DataBase

  2. Establish cataloged list of species according to the state of the phase (gaseous or condensed). It also obtains the indices of cryogenic liquid species, e.g., liquified gases.

  3. Compute Stoichiometric Matrix

ListSpecies(varargin)#

Specify List of Species

Functions#

Check_FOI(self, FOI_species)#

Check that fuel species are contained in the list of products (only for initial computations)

Define_F(self)#

Set Fuel of the mixture

Define_FOI(self, i)#

Set up mixture: fuel, oxidizer and diluent/inert species

Define_I(self)#

Set Inert of the mixture

Define_O(self)#

Set Oxidizer of the mixture

check_inputs(self)#

Check that all the inputs are specified

compute_proportion_inerts_O2(self)#

Compute proportion inerts/O2

create_cell_ntimes(varargin)#

Create cell array with the same item n-times

get_FLAG_N(self)#

Flag if the number of moles of fuel, oxidant and inert species is specified. If not, consider 1 mole for the fuel and calculate the remaining moles from the equivalence relation.

get_index_phase_species(self, LS)#

Get index of gaseous, condensed and cryogenic species

get_typeSpecies(app)#

Create cell array with the type of species in the mixture

postResults(self)#

Abbreviations ———————

Reorginize index of gaseous, condensed and cryogenic species

set_air(app, FLAG_IDEAL_AIR)#

Incluide air in the mixture
